alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 8:17PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kentucky, including the following county, Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 816 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding of creeks and streams, roads, and roadside culverts is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Sterling, Jeffersonville, Camargo, Gatewoods Station, Coons Station, Ewington, Prewitt, Levee, Klondike, Upper Spencer, Howards Mill, Lower Spencer, Wades Mill, Oggs Station, Judy, Grassy Lick, Bean, Walkers Crossing, Lucky Stop and Sideview.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
